speech: Durations in 5e serve a narrative purpose. "1 minute" is shorthand for "about the length of one combat". "10 minutes" is shorthand for "a short period of time not in combat". You would never have a duration of "4 rounds" or "10 rounds". Most combat encounters last 4 to 6 rounds: use 1 minute. Similarly, you wouldn't have a feature that reduces ritual casting from 10 minutes to 1 minute. There isn't much narrative difference between a 1 minute casting time and a 10 minute casting time: neither can happen in combat, and they are both less than the next step, 1 hour. And again, durations such as 30 minutes, 4 hours should not be used. Use 1 hour (a bit of a day) or 8 hours (most of the day). I shouldn't have to point this out, but I've seen editors do this, there should be no durations measured in seconds.
